comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Not "Pyrmont" imho - city side of Darling Harbour.  Maybe 'from' Pyrmont.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/33147718@N05] Can I make a pedantic plea for dropping the use of the word "depict".  I find it really grates on my nerves (!), as a result of the Powerhouse Museum, whose curator overuses the word in their catalogue descriptions - I found one with three times in one sentence.    Please!

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] If you don't deserve to be a pedant about ANMM photos beachcomber, no one does. "Depicting a view" is a tautology isn't it? And we know it's a photograph too - unless it's a photo-realistic painting! :) PS. New leadership team to reshape Powerhouse Museum announced, 28 OCTOBER 2013 - www.powerhousemuseum.com/media/?p=471

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] You're among friends here Beachcomber - plea away. As you know this is a democratic collection - a more thorough editing process will see 'depicting' disappear from your ANMM Flickr experience ;)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] Rose Hiscock gave an interview on ABC Radio Sunday Profile recently about her vision for the Phouse - she sounds great : ab.co/1gI0RiF (PH)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] Thank you!  I am rapidly turning into a Grumpy Old Man!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Meanwhile, back at the image-depiction-view-photograph-artwork-print, I think the photographer was standing on Pyrmont Bridge or close by where the ANMM is now. And the ship on the left has just passed through the bridge. See the Howard Smith Co Ltd wharves marked on this peculiar 1905 birdseye map - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview/?pi=nla.map-f115-sd&rgn=0.... c.1910?
